description: Easy Orange Chia Cranberry Muffins. These breakfast Muffins are simple and full of flavor. Blend up the wet and dry in a blender, pour and bake. Vegan Nut-free Soy-free Recipe. Makes 11 to 12 muffins 1 Bowl or Blender, 6 Main Ingredients
name: Blender Chia Orange Cranberry Muffins
recipeIngredient: 1/2 cup sugar (scant) (I usually use a combination of coconut and unrefined raw sugar)
1 1/4 cup flour (I use 3/4 cup spelt/ whole wheat and 1/2 cup white)

recipeInstructions.text: Blend the wet ingredients except chia seeds. Fold in chia seeds and let sit for 10 mins to hydrate the seeds a bit.
Line a muffin pan with muffin liners. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F / 190oc.

Add the dry ingredients to the blender and pulse a few times to combine. Alternatively, add and whisk all the dry ingredients in a bowl. Add to wet and mix to combine. The batter should be somewhat flowy but not runny. If too runny, add a tbsp or more flour and mix in.
Drop the batter into lined muffin pan. Add cranberries or other berries on top. Sprinkle some chia seeds on top (optional).
Cool for 5 minutes in the pan then a few minutes on the counter before serving. The muffins can be kept on the counter (covered) for the day, or refrigerated upto 5 days.

video.description:
Easy Chia Orange Cranberry Muffins. 6 Main Ingredients!
RECIPE: http://www.veganricha.com/2017/03/blender-chia-orange-cranberry-muffins.html

Make these in 1 Bowl or a Blender. Add seasonal berries of choice. 
These Zesty, Soft Breakfast Muffins are simple and full of flavor. Vegan Nut-free Soy-free Recipe. Makes 11 to 12 muffins.
